content.description: This route climbs the right facing offwidth crack in a nice dihedral to a two bolt anchor at about 50 feet.
content.location: This is the short, right facing corner located just right of Black Blood.  Anchors are visible at the top of the crack.

content.description: Climb a nice crack with a wide section right off the ground to triple bolt anchor.  Good route on good rock.
content.protection: A 5.9 leader would probably want 2-3 sets of cams from #1 camalot size to #3 camalot size.  Maybe one #4 camalot sized cam for the bottom.
content.location: This route is located on the far right side of the Private Pizza wall.  It climbs a nice crack with a wide section off the ground.  Probably 150-200 feet right of Unknown 5.10.  Three bolt anchor is visible from below.

content.description: Climb a decent finger crack to a wide section up top to a two bolt anchor.  The crux is definitely transitioning into the wider section.
content.protection: I found cams from #0.1 - #0.2 Camelot X4s and #0.3 Camelot C4s useful, mainly the #0.3s and maybe a larger #3 for up top.
content.location: This route is located around the corner to the left of Teeter Totter.  The two bolt anchor is visible from below.

content.description: Climb up a pillar (which moves, climb light and carefully) to a stance.  Then climb a #1 camalot sized crack in the corner to a two bolt belay anchor below a roof.  During the first ascent, I climbed the left side of the pillar via a difficult offwidth.  Since the first ascent I have (and it looks like most people have) climbed the right side of the pillar via thin fingertip jams.  The pillar does move and pinches your fingers when you are jamming.  Climb light, to avoid having the pillar fall on top of you.
content.protection: Cams from small to #1 camalot sized camming units.
content.location: This route climbs up a pillar to a right facing corner a couple hundred feet to the right of Private Pizza.

content.description: This is a great introduction to crack climbing.  Climb the double cracks in the corner to a good rest and some interesting/funky crack climbing above the rest to get to a two bolt belay anchor.  This is a great route to practice some crack techniques because you can climb it many different ways practicing some different types of crack climbing.  Good route with good rock.
content.protection: A 5.9 leader will probably want two to three sets of camming devices.
content.location: Private Pizza climbs the cracks in the large dihedral on the left side of the wall below a large roof.

content.description: Varied corner to the left of "Unknown Hand Crack".
content.protection: Single set to hands and then doubles of #3 - #6 camalots

content.description: Climb the shallow corner to a glue-in bolt. Lieback above the first bolt, passing two more bolts. The style changes at the final glue-in bolt that protects the exit moves.
content.protection: Four glue-in bolts to beefy anchors with mussy hooks.
content.location: Located 40' left of Private Pizza on the north facing side of the corner.

content.description: Climb the nice thin hands crack through bulges to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 2-3 sets of cams from #.5 camalot size to #1 camalot size.  Maybe 1 or 2 hand size cams??
content.location: This is the nice thin hands/wide finger crack to the right of Unknown Offwidth.  Anchors are visible from below.

content.description: Climb the offwidth which turns into a squeeze chimney which gets wider until reaching a ledge below a roof and a single bolt anchor.
content.protection: On the first ascent I only got one small cam in about 5 feet before the anchor.  You could probably get a very large cam in just off the ground, but it wouldn't do much good.  Tube chocks may protect the bottom 25 feet or so which is the crux.
content.location: This route is the offwidth/chimney system 40 feet right of Teeter Totter.
